title: Post-Truth and Fake News
keywords: post-truth, fake news, Information consumption, information behaviour
description: This is a module of a MOOC on news literacy, the main purpose of which is to explain the notions of post-truth and fake news and how they threaten democracies and the well-being of societies and individuals.
author: Hacettepe University, Belgrade City Library, National Library of Latvia, UPI - Ljudska Univerza Žalec
publisher: Hacettepe University, Belgrade City Library, National Library of Latvia, UPI - Ljudska Univerza Žalec

title: Information Disorder
keywords: information disorder, disinformation, misinformation, malinformation, infodemic, fabricated content, misleading content, manipulated content, false connection, imposter content, deepfake, false context, conspiracy theories, news satire, news parody
description: This is a module of a MOOC on news literacy, the main purpose of which is to introduce different categories and types of information disorder.
author: Hacettepe University, Belgrade City Library, National Library of Latvia, UPI - Ljudska Univerza Žalec
publisher: Hacettepe University, Belgrade City Library, National Library of Latvia, UPI - Ljudska Univerza Žalec

title: Causes and Consequences of Information Pollution
keywords: causes of information pollution, motivation for information pollution, consequences of information pollution
description: This is a module of a MOOC on news literacy, the main purpose of which is to present causes and consequences of information pollution, increase awareness regarding the motivation behind the creation of information pollution as well as its possible impacts.
author: Hacettepe University, Belgrade City Library, National Library of Latvia, UPI - Ljudska Univerza Žalec
publisher: Hacettepe University, Belgrade City Library, National Library of Latvia, UPI - Ljudska Univerza Žalec

title: The Role of the Internet and Social Media in the Creation of Information Pollution
keywords: trustworthiness of online users, trolls, troll farms, sock puppet accounts, bots, botnets, cyborgs
description: This is a module of a MOOC on news literacy, the main purpose of which is to explain the role of the Internet and social media in the creation of information pollution and the trustworthiness of online users.
author: Hacettepe University, Belgrade City Library, National Library of Latvia, UPI - Ljudska Univerza Žalec
publisher: Hacettepe University, Belgrade City Library, National Library of Latvia, UPI - Ljudska Univerza Žalec

title: The Psychology of Misinformation
keywords: psychology of misinformation, cognitive miserliness, intellectual laziness, satisficing, dual process theory, heuristics, cognitive dissonance, confirmation bias, motivated reasoning, fluency, selective exposure, selective avoidance, pluralistic Ignorance effect, false consensus effect, third-person effect, pseudo-profound bullshit receptivity, continued influence effect, mental models, tainted truth effect,implied truth effect, repetition, illusory truth effect, backfire effect, scepticism, alertness, analytic thinking, friction, inoculation, nudges
description: This is a module of a MOOC on news literacy, the main purpose of which is to present cognitive mechanisms which make people vulnerable to misinformation; which make misinformation persistent and difficult to correct and; which can be used to prevent the influence as well as the spread of misinformation.
author: Hacettepe University, Belgrade City Library, National Library of Latvia, UPI - Ljudska Univerza Žalec
publisher: Hacettepe University, Belgrade City Library, National Library of Latvia, UPI - Ljudska Univerza Žalec

title: The Age of Algorithms
keywords: algorithms, algorithms and news consumption, algorithms and society, filter bubbles, echo chambers, personalization, pre-selected personalization, self-selected personalization
description: This is a module of a MOOC on news literacy, the main purpose of which is to present benefits and consequences of automated decision making, to raise awareness about algorithms, how they work and how they affect people and societies.
author: Hacettepe University, Belgrade City Library, National Library of Latvia, UPI - Ljudska Univerza Žalec
publisher: Hacettepe University, Belgrade City Library, National Library of Latvia, UPI - Ljudska Univerza Žalec

title: Global News Consumption Trends
keywords: news consumption trends, sources of news, gateways to news, intermediaries to news, news avoidance, news overload, sharing of news, trust in the news media, format preference for news, channels of misinformation, concerns about disinformation
description: This is a module of a MOOC on news literacy, the main purpose of which is to present an overview of the global news consumption trends in order to develop an understanding of the attitudes, habits and preferences of news audiences, their awareness of news related issues, the changing environment around news across countries, time, culture and demographic features.
author: Hacettepe University, Belgrade City Library, National Library of Latvia, UPI - Ljudska Univerza Žalec
publisher: Hacettepe University, Belgrade City Library, National Library of Latvia, UPI - Ljudska Univerza Žalec

title: News Literacy

title: Changing Media Environment
keywords: news media, characteristics of new media, dimensions of interactivity, digital revolution, new media

description: This is a module of a MOOC on news literacy, the main purpose of which is to present an overview of the digital revolution and new media tools and the effects of this new ecosystem on people.

title: Journalism, New Journalism Practices and Their Social Effects
keywords: journalistic ethics, ethical codes of journalism, nature of journalism, news values, characteristics of journalism, new forms of journalism, multidimensional journalism, civic journalism, traditional journalism, isolated journalism, passive journalism, citizen journalism, public journalism, participatory journalism, engaged journalism, multidimensional journalism, networked journalism, motives for sharing information
subCompetenceArea: New media and new journalism practices
description: This is a module of a MOOC on news literacy, the main purpose of which is to describe the main characteristics of journalism, explain the impact of journalistic values and define the effects of new journalism practices on society.
